statement: ∀ x : Nat, x = x
solution: intro x; rfl

statement: ∀ x y : Nat, x = y → y = x
solution: intros x y h; symm; exact h

statement: ∀ n : Nat, n + 0 = n
solution: intro n; induction n; rfl; simp [Nat.add_succ, *]

statement: ∀ a b : Nat, a + succ b = succ (a + b)
hint: This is the definition of addition for successor
solution: intros a b; rfl

statement: ∀ a b : Nat, succ a + b = succ (a + b)
solution: intros a b; induction b; rfl; simp [Nat.add_succ, *]

statement: ∀ m : Nat, m * 0 = 0
solution: intro m; simp

statement: ∀ m : Nat, m * 1 = m
hint: Unfold the definition of 1 and use multiplication properties
solution: intro m; simp

statement: ∀ m : Nat, 0 * m = 0
solution: intro m; induction m; simp; simp [Nat.mul_succ, *]

statement: ∀ P Q : Prop, P → Q → P
solution: intros P Q hp hq; exact hp

statement: ∀ P Q R : Prop, (P → Q) → (Q → R) → P → R
solution: intros P Q R hpq hqr hp; apply hqr; apply hpq; exact hp

statement: ∀ P Q : Prop, P ∧ Q → P
solution: intros P Q hpq; exact hpq.1

statement: ∀ P Q : Prop, P → Q → P ∧ Q
solution: intros P Q hp hq; exact ⟨hp, hq⟩

statement: ∀ P Q R : Prop, P ∨ Q → (P → R) → (Q → R) → R
solution: intros P Q R hpq hpr hqr; cases hpq; apply hpr; assumption; apply hqr; assumption

statement: ∀ (X Y : Type) (f : X → Y) (a b : X), a = b → f a = f b
hint: Apply the function to both sides of the equality
solution: intros X Y f a b hab; rw [hab]

statement: ∀ (X Y Z : Type) (f : X → Y) (g : Y → Z), ∃ h : X → Z, ∀ x, h x = g (f x)
solution: intros X Y Z f g; use (g ∘ f); intro x; rfl

statement: ∀ a b : Nat, a ≤ b → b ≤ a → a = b
solution: intros a b hab hba; apply Nat.le_antisymm; exact hab; exact hba

statement: ∀ a : Nat, 0 ≤ a
hint: Zero is the smallest natural number
solution: intro a; apply Nat.zero_le

statement: ∀ a b c : Nat, (a + b) + c = a + (b + c)
solution: intros a b c; apply Nat.add_assoc

statement: ∀ a b c : Nat, a * (b + c) = a * b + a * c
solution: intros a b c; apply Nat.left_distrib

statement: ∀ a : Nat, a ^ 0 = 1
solution: intro a; rfl
